text: The 1982 Arizona State Sun Devils football team was an American football team that represented Arizona State University in the Pacific-10 Conference (Pac-10) during the 1982 NCAA Division I-A football season. In their third season under head coach Darryl Rogers, the Sun Devils compiled a 10–2 record (5–2 against Pac-10 opponents), finished in a tie for third place in the Pac-10, and outscored their opponents by a combined total of 294 to 145. The team's statistical leaders included Todd Hons with 2,338 passing yards, Darryl Clack with 606 rushing yards, and Doug Allen with 424 receiving yards. ==Schedule== ==Roster== ==Rankings== ==Game summaries== ===Washington=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–3 | 1981 | W 26–7 |} ===vs. Oklahoma (Fiesta Bowl)=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- |- align="center" | colspan=3| First meeting |} ==1983 NFL Draft== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="" | Player || Position || Round || Pick || NFL Club |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Jim Jeffcoat || Defensive End || 1 || 23 || Dallas Cowboys |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Vernon Maxwell || Linebacker || 2 || 29 || Baltimore Colts |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Mike Richardson || Cornerback || 2 || 29 || Chicago Bears |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Ron Brown || Wide Receiver || 2 || 41 || Cleveland Browns |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Bryan Caldwell || Defensive End || 3 || 70 || Dallas Cowboys |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Ron Wetzel || Tight End || 4 || 92 || Kansas City Chiefs |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Alvin Moore || Running Back || 7 || 169 || Baltimore Colts |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Mike Black || Punter || 7 || 181 || Detroit Lions |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Walt Bowyer || Defensive End || 10 || 254 || Denver Broncos |- align="center" bgcolor="" |} ==References== Arizona State Category:Arizona State Sun Devils football seasons Category:Fiesta Bowl champion seasons Category:1982 in sports in Arizona
